trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of cells that are selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
The order of cells in the collection is not guaranteed to match the order in which they were selected.
Clears the collection.
This method is not relevant for this class.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> class directly.
To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ClearSelection%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Always thrown.
Determines whether the specified cell is contained in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection"></xref>.
`true` if dataGridViewCell is in the ; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements of the collection to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> array, starting at the specified index.
The one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Inserts a cell into the collection.
This method is not relevant for this class.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> class directly.
To add a cell to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Selected%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The index at which dataGridViewCell should be inserted.
The object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Gets the cell at the specified index.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to get from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> at the specified index.
index is less than 0.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the number of cells in the collection.
Gets a list of elements in the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> containing the elements of the collection.
Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets the number of elements in the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The number of elements in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref> method.
Always throws <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> class directly.
To add a cell to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Selected%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The item to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
Always thrown.

Always throws <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.

`true` if value is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.

The cell to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the value parameter if it is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
